intro: Ruschia acutangula, commonly known as the sharp-leaved Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color, with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the cooler months. Ruschia acutangula is well adapted to arid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in rock gardens.
